N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1725-3.3 - Duties and powers

State Regulations

The board of directors has the responsibility for
establishing policy covering administration of property, interests, business
and transactions of the corporation and may delegate to officers such authority
as it deems necessary. Sound organization dictates that members of the board
should not interfere with day-to-day management and operation of project or
with its employees or intrude upon management functions. Failure to adhere to
this policy reduces the efficiency of the operating staff by creating conflicts
in control and in the chain of command. Notes
